intro: Crotalaria angulosa, commonly known as the angular cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive angular seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. Crotalaria angulosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
